definition: a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement, remove with a flick (of the hand)
details:
noun
- a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
= synonyms: film
- a short stroke
- a light sharp contact, usually with something flexible
= example: a light sharp contact, usually with something flexible
verb
- remove with a flick (of the hand)
- touch or hit with a light, quick blow
= example: touch or hit with a light, quick blow
- cause to make a snapping sound
= synonyms: click
- throw or toss with a quick motion
= example: throw or toss with a quick motion
= synonyms: jerk
- twitch or flutter
= example: twitch or flutter
= synonyms: riffle
- cause to move with a flick
= example: cause to move with a flick
= synonyms: flip
- look through a book or other written material
= synonyms: riffle
- flash intermittently
= example: flash intermittently
= synonyms: flicker
- shine unsteadily
= example: shine unsteadily
= synonyms: flicker
